pattern.name: Number of non-missing values
pattern.description:
Real-world data commonly contain contain missing values. And sometimes they are not missing at random. Thus we mine them.
Technical note: NULL values are not commonly accounted in count() function. Hence we exploit it. An alternative is to use "case then" but that is slower. We could also calculate count(*)-count(@column), but in some databases that can double the execution time.
Do not confuse this pattern with aggregation nor num_children. Aggregation is only for numerical attributes. And num_children works on table level.
pattern.author: Jan Motl
